description.compact: A Message (RFC 2822) object.
Generates a valid Message-ID and switches to it.
Set the subject of the message.
Get the subject of the message.
Set the origination date of the message as a UNIX timestamp.
Get the origination date of the message as a UNIX timestamp.
Set the return-path (bounce-detect) address.
Get the return-path (bounce-detect) address.
Set the sender of this message.

docblock.description:
If multiple addresses are present in the From field, this SHOULD be set.
According to RFC 2822 it is a requirement when there are multiple From addresses, but Swift itself does not require it directly.
An associative array (with one element!) can be used to provide a display- name: i.e. array('email@address' => 'Real Name').
If the second parameter is provided and the first is a string, then $name is associated with the address.

description.compact: Get the sender address for this message.

docblock.description: This has a higher significance than the From address.

description.compact: Set the From address of this message.

docblock.description:
It is permissible for multiple From addresses to be set using an array.
If multiple From addresses are used, you SHOULD set the Sender address and according to RFC 2822, MUST set the sender address.
An array can be used if display names are to be provided: i.e. array('email@address.com' => 'Real Name').
If the second parameter is provided and the first is a string, then $name is associated with the address.

description.compact: Get the From address(es) of this message.

docblock.description: This method always returns an associative array where the keys are the addresses.

description.compact: Set the Reply-To address(es).

docblock.description: Any replies from the receiver will be sent to this address. It is permissible for multiple reply-to addresses to be set using an array. This method has the same synopsis as and . If the second parameter is provided and the first is a string, then $name is associated with the address.

description.compact: Get the Reply-To addresses for this message.

docblock.description: This method always returns an associative array where the keys provide the email addresses.

description.compact: Set the To address(es).

docblock.description: Recipients set in this field will receive a copy of this message. This method has the same synopsis as and . If the second parameter is provided and the first is a string, then $name is associated with the address.

description.compact: Get the To addresses for this message.

docblock.description: This method always returns an associative array, whereby the keys provide the actual email addresses.

description.compact: Set the Cc address(es).

docblock.description: Recipients set in this field will receive a 'carbon-copy' of this message. This method has the same synopsis as and .

description.compact: Get the Cc addresses for this message.

docblock.description: This method always returns an associative array, whereby the keys provide the actual email addresses.

description.compact: Set the Bcc address(es).

docblock.description: Recipients set in this field will receive a 'blind-carbon-copy' of this message. In other words, they will get the message, but any other recipients of the message will have no such knowledge of their receipt of it. This method has the same synopsis as and .

description.compact: Get the Bcc addresses for this message.

docblock.description: This method always returns an associative array, whereby the keys provide the actual email addresses.
